result.execSummary:
The defendant Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Per the Court, all costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the attorney fee trust funds posted in this matter.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr

records.addlTxt: to def.
for payment of attorney fees
for payment
Court Clerk letter to def RE AFT funds.

01:34 PM Defendant, Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr, appeared with Attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Amann: Def to plead G to amended Count 2: Disorderly Conduct; joint recommendation of a fine inclusive of costs of $500.  DA moves to amend count 2 from misdemeanor battery to misdemeanor disorderly conduct, makes statement in support of motion.  Court grants motion to amend Count 2 down to a disorderly conduct.  Case is in victim's rights compliance.  Signed PLQ form submitted to and reviewed by Court.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty to the amended count 2.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders a JOC; Count 1 was dismissed previously.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  Court orders $500 fine inclusive of costs (to be paid out of defendant's atty fee trust).  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
to def. for Ct. Appt. Atty. TRUST fees thru November.  Def. owes $375  w/payment letter to def.
to def. for Ct. Appt. Atty. TRUST fees thru Sept.  Def. owes $125

10:08 AM  Defendant, Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr, appeared with Attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State.  Case is on for a final pre-trial.  Atty Amann updates court- case is still on track for court, but there is a "very good chance" that this will resolve.  Atty Amann to keep court informed.  Bond continues.  Plea/Sentencing date set for 12/9/19 at 1:30 PM.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr, appeared with Attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.   Acknowledge receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.   Def. enters a NG plea to all misdemeanor counts charged in the complaint.   Court advised def. of right to speedy trial.  Speedy trial waived by the def.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Burronnie Lee Brosh Sr, appeared.  Atty. William Lund Norine appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Def. voluntarily appeared in Court for return on warrant.  Court quash warrant.   Def. waives attorney for hearing.  Court advises def. to contact Public Defender's office and if doesn't qualify, may petition the Court for court appointed counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
